    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - Used to run JavaFX. Required to implement the abstract class Application. This method contains 4 lambda expressions that manipulate the scene and various panes, 2 to set up for either a 2 player game or a 4 player game, the other 2 handle the movement actions and placing new pieces onto the board

        public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle makeLightSquare()

        a new Rectangle Class object, it's size is 80 by 80, and it has a light brown color

      • makeDice

        public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle makeDice()
        Returns:
        a new Rectangle Class object, it's size is 60 by 60 and is half of the dice seen on screen. It is only the main light gray body without the text

      • makeFakeInset

        public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle makeFakeInset()
        Returns:
        a new Rectangle with 0 opacity, It is used to mimic an inset so there is spacing between the numbers on the right side of the column of the game board do not overlap and have some breathing room between them.

      • makeBluePiece

        public javafx.scene.shape.Circle makeBluePiece()
        Returns:
        a new Circle Class object, the object is blue with a black border, to fill up a total diameter of 40

      • makeGreenPiece

      • makeRedPiece

        public javafx.scene.shape.Circle makeRedPiece()
        Returns:

      • makePlaceHolder

        public javafx.scene.shape.Circle makePlaceHolder()
        Returns:
        a new Circle Class object, the object has an opacity of 0, this allows this piece to hold the gridPaneDisplay data field to not shrink as pieces are moved throughout the grid

      • makePossibleMove

        public javafx.scene.shape.Circle makePossibleMove()
        Returns:
        a new Circle Class object, the object has an opacity of .5, it is used to show where the players may move any given piece.

      • makeBlueFlag

        public javafx.scene.shape.Polygon makeBlueFlag()
        Returns:
        a Polygon Class object that resembles a flag, the object is blue to signify which team's flag it is.

      • makeDiceLabel

        public javafx.scene.control.Label makeDiceLabel()
        Returns:
        a Label, this is the second half of the dice seen on screen containing the number that is inside. When the code is loaded it defaults to the number 1

      • getNodeByRowColumnIndex

        public javafx.scene.Node getNodeByRowColumnIndex(int row,
                                                 int column,
                                                 javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane)
        Parameters:
        row - a positive integer, for this project specifically it uses the range 0-5, to identify what row any given node is in the piecePlacement data field
        column - a positive integer, for this project specifically it uses the range 0-5, to identify what column any given node is in the piecePlacement data field
        gridPane - any GridPane object will work, but this project uses the piecePlacement GridPane to obtain the node at its row and column coordinate
        Returns:
        a Node Class Object, for this project the node is one of the Circle Pieces. If no piece exists, the method returns null

      • rollDice

        public int[] rollDice()
        Returns:
        an array containing two int values between 1 and 6 to represent the dice rolled inside the game.

      • xCoordinate

        public int xCoordinate(int x)
        Parameters:
        x - any positive int value. This project uses digits between 0 and 358.
        Returns:
        a value between 0 and 4 to represent a specific row when the method is called.

      • yCoordinate

        public int yCoordinate(int y)
        Parameters:
        y - any positive int value. This project uses digits between 0 and 360.
        Returns:
        a value between 0 and 4 to represent a specific column when the method is called.

      • getRowLetter

        Parameters:
        row - any int digit between 0 and 4.
        Returns:
        a letter representing the value inputted.

      • getColumnNumber

        public java.lang.String getColumnNumber(int column)
        Parameters:
        column - any int value between 0 and 4.
        Returns:
        the column value inserted plus 1

      • getShortHandColor

        public java.lang.String getShortHandColor()
        Returns:
        a value based on the turn Label's text, Y for Yellow, R for Red, B for Blue, and G for Green

      • setFontRow

        public void setFontRow(javafx.scene.control.Label label)
        Parameters:
        label - any label, this method gives the label insets and a font

      • setFontColumn

        public void setFontColumn(javafx.scene.control.Label label)
        Parameters:
        label - any label, this method gives the label insets and a font

      • nextTurn

        public void nextTurn()
        Checks the gameBoard data field for the next flag, if it is found it goes to the next player skipping any missing flags until there is only one. When this happens the explanation data field is updated to display the winner of the game

      • setBoard

        public final void setBoard(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane)
        Parameters:
        gridPane - any GridPane, in the case of this project it uses the gameBoard variable inside the start method. It places tiles alternating between the methods, makeDarkSquare() and makeLightSquare(). Placing colored tiles when necessary.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parameters:
        args - This method is only required for compilation. It serves no further purpose.
